name: Imran Khan Cancer Appeal USA
mission: The objectives of this Trust are to generate charitable donations for helping in the treatment of cancer in 3rd world countries, and more specifically, ...
theoryOfChange: By providing state-of-the-art treatment regardless of ability to pay and conducting regional research, the hospital aims to reduce cancer mortality and suffering in Pakistan.

judge_issues.message: The rationale does not explicitly mention the risk deductions applied due to the small board size, which is a key factor in the overall score.

The rationale mentions a lack of granular cost-per-beneficiary data as a moderating factor for the impact score. While accurate, it could be strengthened by also mentioning the weak board governance (1 member) as another significant factor contributing to the lower impact score.
Jargon detected in baseline narrative: 'asnaf categories'

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Board too small: 1 members

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Imran Khan Cancer Appeal, Inc. earns 61/100 due to strong alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance (significant risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.shaukatkhanum.org.pk/zakat (Source: https://www.shaukatkhanum.org.pk/zakat)

all_citations.claim: The charity earned a 95.0/100 score, holds 9.8 months of working capital, and spends $0.02 per $1 raised.
The charity is Zakat-eligible and maintains specific policies for asnaf categories.
Total revenue was $17,974,012 with a program expense ratio of 97.4% focused on SKM Cancer Trust and clinical services.
The organization offers various donation options and methods to support its mission.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The charity demonstrates excellent financial stewardship and high alignment for Muslim donors, though its impact score is moderated by a lack of granular cost-per-beneficiary data.
areas_for_improvement: Limited public data regarding specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics for impact evaluation
Reliance on a specific geographic region for service delivery

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is high at 38/50 due to the organization's strong fit for donors seeking Zakat-eligible causes and the high urgency of global health in the developing world [2][4]. The charity provides multiple ways to donate, including specialized Zakat funds that adhere to Islamic principles [2][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization operates as a direct service provider, focusing on clinical and diagnostic services for cancer patients [3]. While it maintains a strong financial position with 9.8 months of working capital, the lack of specific cost-per-beneficiary data results in a medium impact score of 30/50 [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: Imran Khan Cancer Appeal, Inc. provides life-saving oncological treatment to underserved populations in the developing world through a highly efficient, Zakat-eligible financial model.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 97.4%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach clinical services [1][3]
Highly efficient fundraising operations, spending only $0.02 to raise every $1 [1]
Verified Zakat-eligible status with clear policies for asnaf categories [2]
baseline_narrative.summary: The organization generates charitable donations to fund cancer treatment in third-world countries, specifically supporting the Shaukat Khanum Memorial Cancer Hospital and Research Centre [3]. With a total revenue of $17,974,012, the charity maintains a high level of transparency and financial health, earning a 95.0/100 rating from Charity Navigator [1].

case_against.summary: The primary concern is a <cite id="17">critically small board size</cite> and a geographic concentration that limits service to a single country.

confidence.data_freshness: Financials and ratings current as of 2023/2024
confidence.notes: Strong clinical and financial data available.

alignment.explanation: IKCA is a premier fit for Muslim donors, offering <cite id="12">verified Zakat eligibility</cite> and serving <cite id="13">underserved patients in Pakistan</cite>.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust IKCA due to its <cite id="7">95.0/100 from Charity Navigator score</cite> and <cite id="15">Gold Seal of Approval for hospital accreditation</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization should <cite id="17">expand its board of directors</cite> beyond a single member to enhance independent oversight.

impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="18">reporting specific beneficiary counts</cite> to enable a standardized cost-per-treatment analysis.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to fund high-tech medical interventions for cancer patients in Pakistan through a highly efficient, Zakat-compliant model.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill Zakat obligations through specialized healthcare
Value extreme financial efficiency with 97.4% program ratios
Care about providing modern oncology to those in poverty
Prefer supporting established institutions with a 30-year track record
giving_considerations: Donations support a specific hospital network in Pakistan
The organization has a very lean administrative structure
High transparency in clinical outcomes but limited board diversity
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fund cancer research in the US or those who prioritize organizations with large, multi-member independent boards.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization publishes detailed cancer registry reports with <cite id="8">verified patient counts</cite> and <cite id="16">AJCC staging data</cite>.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: IKCA provides free or subsidized cancer treatment to those unable to pay, funded by international donations and Zakat, leading to reduced mortality and improved health equity.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Clinical evidence ensures that the high-cost treatments provided are meeting international medical standards.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The <cite id="4">26.2% revenue growth</cite> suggests high demand and capacity to expand clinical services in Pakistan.

peer_comparison.differentiator: IKCA's <cite id="5">100.0% program ratio</cite> is significantly higher than the <cite id="10">peer median of 84.6%</cite>.

strengths.detail: The charity directs a <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 97.4%</cite> toward its mission, far exceeding the <cite id="10">peer program ratio median of 84.6%</cite>.
IKCA maintains a <cite id="7">95/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite>, including a <cite id="11">perfect leadership score of 100</cite>.
The organization maintains <cite id="12">verified Zakat-eligible status</cite> with clear policies for serving the <cite id="13">fi-sabilillah and poor asnaf categories</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: The organization's financial health is anchored by its ability to maintain <cite id="14">9.8 months of working capital in working capital</cite>, providing significant long-term stability. This fiscal prudence is matched by clinical excellence; the supported facilities have achieved <cite id="15">Full Enterprise Accreditation from the Joint Commission International</cite>, ensuring that the <cite id="16">6,731 analytical cases staged via AJCC</cite> receive care meeting global standards. Furthermore, the charity's fundraising model is among the most efficient in the sector, requiring only <cite id="6">$0.02 to raise every $1</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Imran Khan Cancer Appeal, Inc. (IKCA) serves as a vital financial lifeline for oncological care in Pakistan, primarily supporting the Shaukat Khanum Memorial Cancer Hospital and Research Centre. Founded in <cite id="1">1994</cite>, the organization has established a robust infrastructure for mobilizing international support to provide <cite id="2">life-saving cancer treatment to underserved populations</cite>. In the 2023 fiscal year, the charity reported a <cite id="3">total revenue of $17,974,012</cite>, representing a significant <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 26.2%</cite>. This growth underscores a strengthening donor base committed to addressing the global health crisis of cancer in developing regions. The organization operates with remarkable financial leaneness, maintaining a <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 97.4%</cite> according to recent filings, which ensures that donor contributions are directed almost entirely toward clinical and diagnostic services. This efficiency is further evidenced by a <cite id="6">fundraising efficiency of $0.02 per $1 raised</cite>, a figure that significantly outperforms industry benchmarks. Beyond financial metrics, IKCA demonstrates high accountability, earning an <cite id="7">overall score of 95.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>. The organization's impact is quantified through its support of specialized facilities that managed <cite id="8">6,894 malignant cases</cite> and <cite id="9">718 pediatric cancer cases</cite> in a single reporting cycle. By combining high-tech medical intervention with a faith-aligned financial model, IKCA bridges the gap between advanced oncology and those who would otherwise lack access to care.
